title: Totally invaluable but broken on Lollipop
comment: Use this when I'm oncall to wake me up when things go wrong, regardless of phone settings. Configurable, reliable & small footprint. Easy to set up & couldn't do oncall without this indispensable app. Update: loses stars for broken "use alarm volume" on Lollipop. Please fix ASAP!

title: Best friend an oncall engineer can have
comment: Without having to even change my messaging app, I get to be woken up only by texts that have content that needs my immediate attention
Works perfect
Wanna try

title: Great app, with one setback
comment: This app works great. You can change the page tone to whatever you want, and is extremely efficient. However, you can only match 1 substring for the sender. However, I need it to match multiple strings. Rating this 4 stars for now, but will bump up to 5 stars once that feature is done!

title: Really want to use it
comment: If it had a time setting for the hours it went off between it would be my number 1 pager app.

title: Mostly great
comment: Open Source app that does what it claims, without unnecessary permissions, and all around a solid app. My only gripe would be a widget to toggle oncall status, and the UI could use a refresh. Also, a schedule on when to auto go oncall and offcall would be nice.

title: Returned to 5 stars!!!
comment: Originally,  this was 5 stars. Then some upgrade was pushed that took away Klaxon's ability to override my volume on Galaxy S3. Now it is fixed! Awesome!  Very useful and thanks so much for fixing it.

title: Sounds level doesn't work right in Lollipop (5.0)
comment: I'm having the same issue as S Kyriacou with my Nexus 5. The alarm sound level isn't being  used, it's using the default SMS volume. I also have it set to repeat the alert with Klaxon, but I'm quite a deep sleeper and it was nice to have the volume be louder. I'll just have to turn up the SMS volume when I'm on call.   This is still a great app though, I've been using it for a year or so and never had any problems. The only exception to this was when work started using MMS instead of SMS for a few months, but this is a known limitation with Klaxon.

title: Not working on my Redmi 1S
comment: Not showing  any errors.. But unable to detect  the messages

title: an issue with upgrade to lollipop
comment: After upgrade to lollipop, it seems that the regular SMS app notification sound "overwrites" the first klaxon notification. The workaround is to have repeat notifications (I have them every 20 secs). So you get the second and subsequent klaxon notifications, which is fine with me. ps: I do have "consume the SMS" on but I guess that does not work

title: Great little app!
comment: I love this - so tiny and just does what it says it will do. Only one very minor issue and one feature request; Consume SMS does not seem to work (pages still get delivered to hangouts on 4.4.4) and I would love a widget to display and toggle my on call status.

title: Extremely close to perfect - One Bug
comment: I've been able to do away with my pager at work thanks to this application.  The only problem I have is that it won't consume SMS on KitKat due to a bug - having only the pages go to this app would make it perfect for my use.

title: Everything works but could use
comment: Vibration mode..  I assume it's supposed to just vibrate but it's not working if the phone is on silent.. it will alarm on silent.. I assume vibrate only works if the phone is not on silent mode.. I need something that would bypass silent mode

title: Works great
comment: So far works great

title: Wonderful program that actually works
comment: Finally a text/Pager program that works....I was just about to give up then this one showed up out of the blue.thank you very much!

title: Review
comment: Works fine for one SMS page, however as mentioned by others would be nice to have alerting for multiple SMS accounts.

title: Great for being in-call - until KitKat
comment: Been using for 4+ years as a pager for hospital. Unfortunately KitKat update introduced a bug that will no longer allow the app to consume earmarked text messages.  Bummer!  Looking for another option since it can't be fixed.

title: No longer consumes SMS
comment: My phone updated to the latest kit kat, and klaxon no longer consumes texts. Still a great application though!

title: Just what I needed
comment: Recent VZW update has caused SMS parsing to not work correctly. The app is still great just need to figure out why the latest phone update broke some function.

comment: Thanks for this enhancement

title: New issue
comment: On android 4.4 consume sms option doesn't work anymore. Please fix this. Thanks !

title: Great!
comment: I depend on it for work, great app! And it doesn't ask for any unnecessary permissions!

title: OS Upgrade Broke Volume Override
comment: Would give 5 stars until the last OS update. Prior to update even if my volume was set to silent Klaxon would use the alarm volume. Now Klaxon's volume is whatever you have notifications set to. Use alert volume function is broken.

title: Must have app for an Amazonian
Works
comment: Not very refined, but is very reliable

title: great app
comment: never fails
Best pager app ever.

title: So very close to doing exactly what I need
comment: This works wonderfully, for one number (or forwarded e-mail address).  Plays the sound you want or vibrates as you want it to, and when it goes off, it works wonderfully.    I can only ask for one other thing, due to the way the company I work for does things, there's never just one number or sender.  Never just one subject either.  If I could add multiple numbers and multiple criteria, it would be absolutely perfect.  Otherwise, it's exactly what I need.  And I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a constant reminder to wake you up in the middle of the night when something breaks, or someone runs into a work stopping apocalyptic problem.

New samsung s3 os update disabled feature that usrd alarm volume for noyificationd even if your main volume was turned off. This was a great way to not hear the phone either ring or email notifs but sounded when text came in (like a pager). Hopefully an update will follow to fix.

title: Needs to support multiple senders
comment: Works great for a single sender, but no obvious option to support another.
Works well as a pager substitute. Looking forward to MMS support thanks to ...	Works well as a pager substitute. Looking forward to MMS support thanks to T-Mobile's auto conversion of long messages.

title: Great app!
comment: Let me pitch my pager and use my phone. Works great!

title: Was perfect
comment: This is a great app to have for my IT on call rotation, but now that I have upgraded my phone from a Galaxy S2 to a Galaxy S4 it no longer uses the alarm volume option.  Once fixed for my phone I will give it 5 stars again.

title: Just what I need
comment: I needed an app that would work for my Android phone as our paging company does not have adequate service in many areas I travel to. This app fills the need nicely.

title: Great
comment: Does its job.

title: Does not work
comment: Tried phone number as well as email for sender pattern matching.. Never picks it up

title: Outstanding App
comment: This is an outstanding pager app. Finally, an app that can actually replace my pager. Pros:  - Can use alarm volume level even when phone is on silent or asleep. - Will repeat the alarm at intervals you select, so that if you miss it the first time you will eventually catch it again. - Can stop the SMS message from going to other apps such as the messaging app. This way it is only in the pager app and you don't have to clean it out of multiple lists.  Features that could be added to make it totally perfect: - Multiple triggers. My boss works in IT and is a member of two volunteer firefighter departments, so for him, having multiple triggers for multiple senders would be good. - A widget that could allow you to turn on call on and off, so that you don't have to go through the menu to do it. - Displaying the message even when the phone is locked and allowing confirmation, similar to how a phone call shows up and allows you to answer it even when the phone is locked.  These are minor things though... the feature set overall is excellent and does just what I need. I especially like the interval feature, much better than FireAlert's continuous duration feature.

title: A joke.
comment: Period.

title: Finally!
comment: A pager that wakes me up! Love it!

title: it stopped working
comment: Everything was fine until beginning of July ... now the pages are going back to SMS :( ...

title: just what I wished existed
comment: I had a working text to wake my a$$ up solution for my system alerts at work.  But it was through Tasker and was complex as heck.  That is not a slam on tasker - it can be great if you put in the time. But this is all I wanted.  Brilliant way of using the 'Alarm' volume to make a sound to wake me up when I need it to.  This outsmarts the really dumbed down Android sound settings which I hate.  That is the only thing I miss from Blackberry. post something in the app so I can donate to you.

title: Not find matching SMS
comment: I am trying to get this to work for emailed SMS message and it will not match. I try different about give different keywords WI success...too bad... This product looked nice

title: Great SMS paging app
comment: great and worth getting. Makes SMS paging quicker and easier. Very helpful to those who have multiple pages' to handle whilst on call. you can also choose via the preferences section to consume the SMS texts from other apps resulting in your inbox staying empty while you go "on-call".

title: On/Off
comment: Please!!! add on/off toggle widget. it is a real pain to have to go Klaxon/Menu/Preferences/On call just to turn the thing on and off. Otherwise great.

title: Awesome
comment: Best app for a sound sleeper like me. First pager app that I am really impressed with

title: Great way to not miss texts
comment: Get text alerts for work and thus makes sure you don't miss any.
Best app I have

title: No more work pager

title: Works great

title: Great app!!!
comment: Needs a scheduling feature.  Otherwise excellent!!

title: Lots of potential
comment: Five star app, huge productivity loss without this app. But, setup could be streamlined a bit & lots of features could be added, can't wait for future updates.

title: Useful for persistent calendar reminders too
comment: I've started using Klaxon to get repeating reminders for calendar events:  - in Google Calendar's web interface, add SMS reminders to important events.  - in Klaxon's SMS settings, set "Reminder:" as the sender, and check "also match message body".  Then you'll get an appropriately obnoxious reminder that persists until you view the message, not just Calendar's single beep that's too easy to miss.  Not sure if this is a supported use case, but this could make the app useful for people who don't need a pager too :-)

title: This app....
comment: Great app!!!! Better than my work pager!! Great really is...I use it in a hospital :) am excuse to play on my phone!!

title: Makes SMS a good oncall page solution
comment: I've always been concerned that when I get a text I will miss it.  This makes sure that I respond when a text message is sent.  It has always worked well.  And very nice that I can just turn it off when not on call

title: Awesome
comment: This app is the reason I can not leave android. Defintely a must for people on call.

title: Perfect app for me
comment: I used to have a straight talk phone that when ever I got a text it would ring every 5 mins untill I looked at the message. I recently switched to a lg optimus q from straight talk and was dissapointed that when I would get a txt it would only alert me once. This app alerts you about once a min untill you answer.

title: Important app, good features but needs improvement
comment: I like this app and it does what it says, but it's not a replacement for a pager yet. It still needs some new features/settings and I'll be happy to add notes to the developers bug tracker. I use it with Sprint SNPP to send SMS texts directly to our phones (no email server). Just remember to keep your phone charged (real pagers last for weeks on a single battery). With this I can still use normal text messages with friends but keep work messages separate with repeating alerts until I read them.

title: Great little app!
